meanings.definition: The quality of being persistent or determined.
meanings.sent1: Her pertinacity in finishing her homework every day is admirable.
meanings.sent2: His pertinacity in pursuing his dreams led to his success.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the ant showed pertinacity in carrying the heavy leaf.
meanings.sent4: The pertinacity of the old tree roots breaking through concrete symbolized resilience.
meanings.sent5: The student's pertinacity in studying for the exam paid off with a high grade.

meanings.definition: The act of holding firmly to a belief or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The pertinacity of her faith helped her through tough times.
meanings.sent2: His pertinacity in fighting for justice inspired others to join him.
meanings.sent3: The pertinacity of the cat in catching the elusive mouse was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The pertinacity of the river carving through the rock over centuries was a marvel.
meanings.sent5: The pertinacity of the detective in solving the case finally paid off.

meanings.definition: The state of being stubborn or obstinate.
meanings.sent1: His pertinacity in refusing to change his mind caused conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The pertinacity of the child in wanting the toy was relentless.
meanings.sent3: The pertinacity of the squirrel in stealing bird food was amusing to the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The pertinacity of the storm in shaking the windows made the house feel vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The pertinacity of the weeds in growing through the cracks showed nature's resilience.
